New Records: Freddie Freeman ended Game One with the first ever walk-off grand slam in the World Series
Key Match Events: Giancarlo Stanton mashed a low slider inside for a moonshot to left field which scored Soto and gave the Yankees a 2–1 lead
Freddie Freeman smashed a first pitch fastball to the stands to win the game
Post-Match Reflections: Aaron Judge’s postseason struggles continue, with a 1-for-5 day, but three strikeouts and missing big opportunities for the Yankees could be a big highlight to their loss

The Dodgers (98–64) and Yankees (94–68) each held the best records in their respective leagues this season. It is the first time that the top teams in each league are facing off in the Fall Classic since the Dodgers bested the Rays in the 2020 World Series and the first time in a full season since 2013 when the Red Sox topped the Cardinals
Miscellaneous Highlights: It was the 63rd walk-off win in World Series history and the 63rd Fall Classic game that went to extra-innings
